question: Vodka.
answer: More. Does Mom know you're here? It's gotta be past 10.

question: Don't worry about it. Start from the beginning. Tell us what happened...
answer: We spent the whole day together. We went shopping. We had coffee. We saw a film. We bought music. I thought it was a great day.

question: And then what happened?
answer: Um...you know what...let's go crazy, I'll have BOTH. God, I love eating pancakes at night. It's like the greatest thing ever. How great is this?

question: This thing. This whatever it is. You and me. Do you think this is normal?
answer: I don't know. Who cares about normal?! I'm happy. Aren't you happy?

question: You're happy?
All we do is argue!
You know what they say...there's plenty other fish in the sea.
Sure they do. They say that.
answer: Well they're wrong. It's not true. I've fished in that sea. I've jumped in and swam in that sea! I'm fucking Aquaman! Sorry. What I mean is... there are no other fish. This was my fish. I'm in love with Summer. I love her smile. I love her hair. I love her knees. I love how one eye is higher up on her face than the other eye. I love the scar on her neck from this operation she had as a kid. I love how she looks in my Clash T- shirt. I love how she looks when she's sleeping. I love the sound of her laugh. I love how I hear this song every time I think of her. I love how she makes me feel. Like anything's possible. Like, I don't know...like life is worth it. For real, Paul. I'm madly in love with that girl.

question: Hmmm. That's an intriguing idea McKenzie. Along with Grossman's "Magellan Day" I'd say we've got some potential here. What do you think Hansen? Could you write up some prototypes for these?
answer: Excuse me, Mr. Vance? There's a call for you on line 3.

question: Everyone this is Summer, my new assistant. Summer just moved here from...
Right. Michigan. Well, Summer, everyone. Everyone, Summer. Excuse me, I have to take this.
What do we know about this new girl?
The new girl. Summer. In Vance's office.
answer: Dude. I hear she's a bitch from hell! Patel tried to talk to her in the copy room. She was totally not having it.

question: Maybe she was just in a hurry.
answer: And maybe she's some uppity, better than everyone, superskank.

question: Damn.
That makes me so mad! Why is it pretty girls always think they can treat people like crap and get away with it?
Like, just cause she has high cheekbones and soft skin...
And maybe the world's most perfect breasts...Just cause of that stuff, she can walk around like she's center of the universe?
Ugh. You know what? Screw her! We haven't even met and I can't stand her already.
answer: The Smiths. I love The Smiths.

question: Sorry?
answer: I said. I love The Smiths. You have good taste in music.

question: Oh my god. Hi.
So, uh, Summer...
Yeah! How's it going so far?
Both... Either.
answer: I'm happy. Still getting situated. How long have you worked here?

question: Oh, you know, 4, 5... years.
answer: Really? Jesus. Did you always want to write greeting cards?

question: Are you nuts? I don't even want to do it now.
answer: What is it you want to do?

question: I studied to be an architect actually.
Eh, you know. Same old story. Moved to the city to work for a company. Company went under. Needed a job. My friend worked here. Got me this.
Well I wrote that one. It's a big seller.
answer: I meant, are you any good as an architect?

question: Oh... No. I doubt it.
answer: Well, I'd say you're a perfectly ...adequate... greeting card writer.

question: Why thank you. That's what they called me in college. "Perfectly adequate" Hansen.
answer: They used to call me "Anal Girl." Anyway, I should get back.

question: Ok, well, I'll see you around. And it turns out she's read every Graham Greene novel ever published. Her desk is lined with Magritte posters and Edward Hopper.
We're so compatible it's insane! Seriously! It doesn't make sense! She's not like I thought at all. She's... amazing.
What?
answer: You know...just cause some cute girl likes the same bizarro music you do doesn't make her "the one."

question: When one strongly believes in something, it takes overwhelming contradictory evidence to change their minds. Tom had always been a devout believer in the idea of "true love." Exhibit A Exhibit B
answer: I'm so glad we decided to go away together Bec. I know we've only been dating a few months but it's been...awesome.

question: Exhibit C
answer: And now, you and me, 8 days in Mexico... best spring break ever!

question: It's just... it's complicated.
answer: What's complicated? Last week you said you loved me!

question: I know it's sudden but...
answer: No, this can't be. Everything was going so great. I don't understand. What's this?

question: Because you're, like, the biggest music nerd I've ever met, I think this should really help explain where I'm coming from. You remember how much I loved this song when you first played it for me?
answer: Sure. It's all you wanted to listen to for weeks.

question: Right. And I still like it, don't get me wrong. It's just... When I hear it now, I don't feel the same...rush.
I press the skip button.
answer: What does this have to do with--?

question: I'd rather listen to something else.
answer: But Amanda... this is a great fucking song! It's off.

question: I think you know what I need. Toner.
Do you want to go out with me? And the Priest says, "But we're already out!"
I know! Not once did she take the bait. Not once. Screw it. I'm done with her. It's over.
answer: This Friday. 10 bucks all you can karaoke at The Well.

question: No way McKenzie. Absolutely not.
They won't let you back in there after last time.

Not at all. You just threw up on the stage, tried to fight the bartender, and then threatened to burn the place down before passing out on the sidewalk. Quiet night for you. We are not going back there.
answer: This is a work thing, Tommy. It won't be like that. The whole office is going.

question: I really can't. Even if I wanted to. There's a lot of stuff I gotta take care of.
What?
answer: The whole office is going. Tom looks over to where Summer sits. And realization dawns on him...

question: Yeah?
I named my cat after Springsteen.
Bruce.
Me? No.
Don't really want one.
answer: Come on. I don't believe that.

question: You don't believe a woman could enjoy being free and independent? No, I'm not a lesbian. I'm just not comfortable being somebody's "girlfriend." I don't want to be anybody's anything, you know?
answer: I have no idea what you're talking about.

question: Summer, hold on... you don't believe in love?
answer: I don't even know what that word means. I know I've never felt it, whatever it is in all those songs. And I know that today most marriages end in divorce. Like my parents.

question: Well mine too but --
answer: Oh yeah, And I read in Newsweek, there were these scientists who found that by stimulating a part of the brain with electrodes you can make a person fall in "love" with a rock. Is that the love you're talking about?

question: Well...
answer: Why, what's your take on it?

question: Anyway, I'm not near drunk enough to sing in front of all these people.
It would take at least ten shots to get me to sing.
That's not it.
I have no idea.
answer: I used to watch it every week.

question: Me too. Why can't we think of the stupid A-Team theme song.
This is gonna bother me for weeks.
"And I'd proudly stand UP!" I said stand!
This guy.
answer: Ok, let's get you in a cab.

question: No. I'm gonna walk. I live right down that street. Or that one.
Hey.
Not you. You. He likes you. I mean... likes you, likes you. For real. Tell her Tom.
answer: Sorry you had to see that. Happens every time we come here. It's unbelievable. Something about that guy and singing for people. I don't know. But at least he didn't --

question: Sorry you had to see that. Happens every time we come here. It's unbelievable. Something about that guy and singing for people. I don't know. But at least he didn't --
What?
answer: You know what. Do you...like me?

question: Yeah. I like you. Of course I do.
Right. As a friend.
Yes. I mean... I haven't really thought about... Yes. Why?
answer: Nothing. I just... You're interesting. I'd like us to be friends. Is that ok?

question: Oh yeah totally. Friends. You and me. That's... perfect.
Cool.
answer: Well, I'm that way. Good night Tom.

question: G'night Summer. Friends. Awesome. That's just great. Well done Hansen, you idiot.
Hey! Hey Mr. Vance.
You son of a bitch. Last night, karaoke night? The same girl you'd been whining and crying and bitching about for weeks now?
The same girl you said was way out of your league and you'd have no chance with no matter what. That girl?
Did you bang her?
Blow job?
Hand job?
answer: No, Paul, no jobs. I'm still unemployed. We just kissed.

question: Come on, level with me. As your best friend, who tolerated a whole month of talk talk talk about this girl, nothing but Summer this, Summer that, Summer Summer Summer, I mean you were practically stalking her...
Oh crap.

Summer, wow what an unusual name. I'm sure I'd remember that if I had heard it before. Tom, how come you've never mentioned you knew such a lovely little lady? Or perhaps you have and I've just forgot. I mean, with all the women in Tom's life it's hard to keep track... Ok, well, I was just... I'm Paul.
(not sure what else to
If you heard...
Excellent. You ready to go.
Check them out. I am very turned on right now.
answer: Sometimes you can be so judgmental.

question: Huh?
answer: I mean, who are you? They're happy. Just mind your own business.
Too soon to say. It's all in the dismount.

question: If we're lucky, there won't be a dismount.
answer: I can't believe them. I have like zero patience for PDA.

question: I hear ya. If I want to watch people make out, I have big windows and binoculars at home.
answer: Yeah? This is fun. You're fun.

question: Thanks.
answer: I mean, I just want to say, up front, I'm not looking for anything serious. Are you cool with that? It freaks some guys out when I say that.

question: Not me.
answer: Let's just have fun. Let's just...hang out, no pressure, no labels, no obligations.

question: Sure. Yeah. I'll be...back in a sec. Settle. Don't get too excited. She's just a girl. There's lots of them. Who look like that. And like what you like. They're everywhere. Calm yourself. Are you calm?

Oh sweet Jesus! I fucking hate Summer. I hate her crooked teeth. I hate her 1950s haircut. I hate her knobby knees. I hate her lopsided, asymmetrical, cock-eyed head. I hate that centipede-shaped scar. I hate her...stupid...big boobs. I hate the way she sleeps. I hate the way she laughs. I HATE THIS FUCKING SONG! It's very... complex.
answer: Complex. Yes. In a way, it speaks so much by saying... so little.

question: I feel the same way. You wanna go to the movies? A lot of people have problems with this, but to me, it makes both structures so much more beautiful side by side like that. The guy who made this, Maybeck, he is a God. It just makes you feel... peaceful. No. See now, this is torture.
Over there, that's St. Patrick's church. The beauty of St. Patrick's is its humility. With this giant mirror thing deflecting all the attention away, it's too humble. No one even knows it's there.
There's a million things. First, there's no need for this much glass. You could easily...
What?
answer: Don't talk about it. Do it.

question: See this beam, it steps on the landscape. But if we moved it... just so...
No you go first.
This is not at all as easy as it looks.
Why not?
answer: "Octopus's Garden?" You may as well just say "Piggies?"

question: I told you. I love Ringo.
Why?
Why yes, in fact I do. Her name is Robyn. See Tom, it's easy.
answer: It is when you've been with the same girl since high school.

question: You've been "seeing" this girl, what, two months now?
And you haven't discussed it?
answer: No! She's not... We're not like that.

question: You were saying?
answer: My thinking is... why rock the boat? Things are going well. If we start putting labels on it, that's like the kiss of death. Like saying to a girl "I love you."

question: I know what you mean. That's what happened with me and Sean.
My boyfriend before Mark.
answer: Who the f--! Never mind. Help me. I need solid female advice.

question: I'm 12.
answer: Yeah but, you know me. This is the kinda stuff that always gets me in trouble.

question: Hmm. So, basically you do want to ask the question, `are we boyfriend/girlfriend?' You're just afraid you'll get an answer you don't want and that will shatter your illusions of how good everything's been these past few months. Is that about right? Thomas, tell me this. Is it worse to get the wrong answer now... or find out in a month she has a date coming up with Lars from Norway?
He's a professional surfer with Brad Pitt's face and Jesus's abs.
You see what I mean? Later dude.
answer: Coach, no, wait! I need her. Rachel, what do you think I should do?

question: Hi.
Are you ok?
You sure?
answer: Summer, I've gotta ask you something.

question: Ok. Wait! Whoa. Oh my god. We can't talk during this song. It's too beautiful.
answer: "So he broke your heart. You've been sad and depressed for weeks. Perhaps you've turned to drinking or even drugs. And nothing's helped. Now what? Should you binge on rocky road and watch soaps all day?" "No you should not." "Through extensive research, we have found the six most effective ways to get over that lost love and make room in your heart for a new man to fill. Those steps are:" "One. Exercise. The body's release of endorphins will assuage the brain and provide a genuine sense of accomplishment and success." "Two. Physical and Mental relaxation. Channel all of your energies to the core of your being for a new understanding of the self and others." "Three. Charity. Reach out! You are not alone in your pain." "Four. Shoe Shopping! Ladies...you know you want to. Indulge!" "Five. Travel. Take some time to see another environment. Get perspective. It's a beautiful world. It will be for you again someday." "Six. Redecorate. Start anew." "By taking these few steps, you will have discovered your inner strength and should be ready to move on. I bet you can hardly remember his face at all." I just don't get women's fashion nowadays. Everybody with the tattoos, the giant hoop earrings, those annoying hats. Explain this to me.

question: People think it looks good.
On some.
Yeah? What if I started wearing berets and got a huge butterfly tattoo on my leg?
Hey.
Ok.
Yeah not too far.
answer: I've never seen you here before.

question: You're not too perceptive.
answer: Ha. That's funny. So, uh, let me buy you a drink.

question: No thank you.
answer: Are you with this guy? Whatever. Come on, one drink. What are you drinking?

question: Sorry, no thank you.
Did you see that punch? I don't know where it came from. I haven't punched someone since Josh Greenberg in fifth grade. Guess I'm gonna have to throw out this shirt. Hey. What is it?
What?
answer: You were so completely uncool in there.

question: You're mad at me? I just got my ass kicked for you.
answer: Oh that was for me? You were, what, protecting me? Next time Tommy, don't. I fight my own battles.

question: Come on, that guy was an asshole!
answer: You didn't have to hit him. Why didn't you just let me handle it?

question: I don't know. He was --
answer: See. This is why I don't want a serious relationship.

question: Whoa. What was that?
answer: Nothing. Look, I like you Tom. I like this. What we've been doing. But maybe it's gone too...

question: What...?
answer: I told you all along what I don't want and it's... I'm tired. Can we talk about this tomorrow?

question: I just got my ass kicked! I got one good shot in. What's up?
Ok. Wait, are you still mad at me?
Holy shit you are. I can't believe you!
Yeah. I'm all done. You know what... Sometimes you really don't make any sense.
Huh?
answer: Say you're sorry for acting like a jerk.

question: I am. I'm sorry for acting like a jerk.
Summer... we don't have to label what we're doing. I just... I need -
Consistency. I need to know you won't wake up tomorrow and feel a different way.
answer: I can't promise you that. Nobody can. Anyone who does is a liar. I can only tell you how I feel right now... or I can show you.

question: Have you ever had a real "boyfriend?"
A boyfriend. "Going steady." Whatever. You know what I mean.
More than one?
Tell me about them.
Why?
Come on, I'm interested.
answer: You wanna have the relationship history conversation?

question: Yes.
No. Yeah. I don't know. Why not? I can take it.
answer: Ok. Well, in high school, there was Markus.

question: Quarterback slash homecoming king?
answer: He was a rower. Very hot.

question: What happened to Markus?
answer: He works for the Republican party. Very successful. Just not for me.

question: Ok. And then?
answer: Well, for a short time in college, there was Kurt. That didn't really go anywhere.

question: The Puma?
And that's it?
What happened? Why didn't they work out?
answer: Nothing happened really. It's what always happens. Life.

question: So how long have you known Paul and Robyn?
No way, really? That's crazy.
Well I'm glad you called. They spoke very highly of you.
So...uh... how's it going?
You've been pretty quiet.
I'm pretty quiet too. Usually. It's nice sometimes to be comfortable enough that you can just sit and eat and not have to say anything, you know?
Do you want to try some --
answer: No thanks. I'm sorry. It's just... there's this girl.

question: Oh.
answer: I'm not usually like this. I wasn't before... Long story short, she wrecked me. I don't know if you can tell but it was pretty recent and I'm still kinda thinking about her. I can't get her out of my head, you know? I see her everywhere. She's all I think about. And it's horrible. Cause I totally didn't see it coming. I thought things were fine. So now I keep going through every day in my mind, every second really. Wondering. What went wrong? Is it my fault? Could I have prevented it somehow? A lot of people have problems with this, but to me, it makes both structures so much more beautiful side by side like that.

question: Anyway... sorry. If I'm acting strange, that's why.
answer: It's ok. I'm sure it's tough getting over an ex-girlfriend.

question: Actually she was never my girlfriend. I just... I thought I'd have figured it out by now, you know? My life. Where I'm going, where I want to end up, who with. All that stuff. I still don't know anything. And the thing is... When I was with Summer, none of that mattered. I never even noticed how much of my life was missing! Isn't that weird?
answer: You were in love, that's what it does. But, now that you know where the holes are you can start to fill them.

question: Sure.

So what do you think? Did I do something? Did I not do something? What can I do now? Oh! You know what we should do... "You said you'd stand by your man!/So tell me something I don't understand. You said you loved me!/And that's a fact! And then you left me, said you felt trapped! "You didn't stand by me! Not at all! You didn't stand by me," I'm talking about you Summer!
Hello me. You having a good day?
answer: I am thank you. Listen, about tonight... I think I might just stay in and go to bed early.

question: What? Why?
answer: I'm just really tired and I've gotta go in early tomorrow. Would you be super mad at me if we went out this weekend instead?

question: Well... You don't want to just, maybe, go to dinner. I mean, you've gotta eat right?
answer: I'm not really that hungry. And this place is fancy right?

question: Sorta.
answer: I'd rather not. Seriously, do you mind?

question: Hey, no, that's cool. Whatever you want to do.
answer: Thank you. So we'll talk tomorrow, alright?

question: Sure.

Why don't you try... "Everyday you make me proud. But today, you get a card." No worries. This is good Millie. "To my wife, the love of my life. I love you." That's very nice. I was thinking though, why not try something like... "Everyday that we don't meet is meaningless and incomplete." You know, spice it up a little. Did you try... "Merry?" What else you got? "...aint no woman got what you got, sista girl. Happy birthday to the lean, sheen, and sizzly mocha queen!" Yeah. It's pretty cool. You really want to see this?
It's, like, all stabbing and shit.
Ok.
answer: All you take me to are sappy little romances. I want to see some open wounds, damn it. I want carnage.

question: Fantastic. Oh shit.
You going to see the serial killer one?
Great! Should we save you seats?
Sorry about that.
You wanna go do something else? We can totally bolt.
answer: Did you tell them I was your girlfriend?

question: What?! No way... I never used that word.
answer: They seemed to think... I mean, why is your step-dad giving me a hug?

question: He's very...loving.
answer: Does he hug all your friends? You're not having any fun.

question: You're having enough for both of us.
answer: I'm dancing. I haven't danced in ages. God. Come on.

question: No.
answer: Come on! I wanna dance with you.

question: Where were you an hour ago? I might have danced then. I've been standing here by myself this whole time and you didn't look over once.
I'm not pissed. Summer... you know I hate this shit.
This is what you wanted to do so...we're doing it.
answer: Yeah well, I didn't need a chaperone. Go home. You're a buzzkill standing there pouting. Tom!

question: You wanted to see me, Mr. Vance?
Ok. What do you mean?
answer: A death in the family, someone taken ill...anything like that?

question: No.
answer: Look, I don't mean to pry. Does this have something to do with Summer leaving.

question: Who? Your...? I'm not following.
answer: For example, here's something you wrote last week... (reads from a card on his

question: Mr. Vance... are you firing me?
answer: No, no, no. Relax Hansen. You're one of our most... adequate writers.

question: Ok. Well, I'm sorry. Things for me have been a little difficult.
answer: That's ok. I understand that. I was just thinking... perhaps you could channel your energy into... this.

question: Funerals and sympathy?
answer: Misery, sadness, loss of faith, no reasons to live... it's perfect for you. Whaddaya say? Good? Good. Now back to work you go.

question: Thats what we wanted to ask you.
You've been much much better.
answer: So maybe it's best we don't ever bring her up again.

question: Just let sleeping dogs lie.
How do you know? Jesus Christ people! Get a room!
answer: Tom! I've been calling every five minutes. Are you ok?

question: What? Oh yeah. Great.
Twinkies?
I'm out of twinkies.
Go... where?
Wait, what's this? Ooh... fancy! Look at this one with all the hearts. Let's open it up. "Happy Valentine's Day, Sweetheart. I love you." Oh that's nice.
If someone gave me this card, Mr. Vance... I would eat it.

I think we do a bad thing here. People should be able to say how they feel, how they really feel, without some strangers putting words in their mouths. The truth. A card is a nice thought but it shouldn't do the dirty work for you. You love someone, tell them yourself, in your own words. Maybe it's not love at all. Maybe there's no such thing as love. Maybe it's... "galoogoo." It's all crap. We make and peddle crap. And sometimes people believe in this crap. I just can't do it anymore, Mr. Vance. There's enough bullshit in the world without my help. I quit. There's no fucking way!
And you said she was single at Christmas.
And now she's...
Now she's getting married.
Married?
It's impossible. It doesn't make sense. Where did they meet? Is it someone we know?
I can't believe it either!
answer: What are you 30? You should be married now. With a family. What are you waiting for?

question: The right girl I guess.
answer: There's girls everywhere. I bet you have to beat em off with a stick.

question: Well...glad you came?
answer: Of course. Where am I exactly?

question: When you turn 13 in the Jewish religion, you officially become an adult.
answer: Wow. So this is a big day in your sister's life.

question: Pretty big, yeah.
You having fun? You were great this morning.
answer: Yeah yeah yeah. Talk to me. How are you?

question: Me? I'm good. I'm great.
Yeah.
Yup. Anyway, who cares about me? This is your day.
answer: You know, my friends... they're all in love with you.

question: Is that right?
That's nice.
answer: What I tell ya? There are plenty other fish in the sea.

question: Those are guppies.
answer: Who knows, someday one might turn out to be your "true love."

question: Are you making fun of me now?
I got news for you Rach. That true love stuff... it's make-believe.
It's the new me. Alright... go play with your friends.
Hmm?
answer: I know you think she was the perfect girl for you...

question: Hey.
Are you still sleeping? 10:30. Are we still hanging out today?
I'll meet you at Liberty in... 20 minutes?
So how was last night?
answer: It was fine. Just a work thing.

question: Where did you guys go?
Fun?
answer: Uneventful. Didn't get home until after 12 though which is way too late for a stupid work function. How was your night?

question: Pretty standard. It's playing at 5.
I don't know. You wanna maybe go back to your place or ---
answer: I want to see it. Let's go.

question: Ok cool.
No, I will. That's fine.
Hey. Hey Sum, it's just a movie.
Is everything alright with you?
answer: Yeah. I'm just...I'm sorry. I'm being ridiculous.

question: It's ok. This happens to me every time I watch "Hoosiers." Let's go for a walk, ok. Let's get some air. Or go to Sister Ray's.
It pains me that we live in a world where no one's ever heard of Spearmint.
And it's painful. Oh look.
So... Now what?
answer: Now...I think I'm gonna call it a day.

question: Yeah? You wanna maybe...get some dinner or something?
Are you hungry?
Ooh!
I've got a great idea!
Let's get breakfast.
Pancakes?
What? Oh. Nowhere. How long have you been sitting there?
answer: Awhile. I come here a lot. I always loved this place, ever since you brought me here.

question: So... I should probably say congratulations.
answer: Probably. But only if you mean it.

question: I don't know if I do honestly.
Yeah well...anyway...I hope you're happy.
answer: You really do? How are you, Tom?

question: I'm good. Ish.
Yeah I quit the office.
answer: Really? That's great! What are you doing now?

question: Mostly...sleeping. Breaking things. So who's the guy?
Yeah... Wait. Don't tell me. I don't want to know.
No really, I don't.
It's amazing to me. You're married.
You're not only someone's girlfriend, your someone's wife!
What's different now? How could things change so quickly?
answer: I don't know. It just happened.

question: What happened?! That's what I don't get.
What, tell me...
answer: I woke up one day and I knew. I knew I could promise him I'd feel the same way every morning. In a way that I... I never could with you.

question: You know what sucks? Realizing that everything you believe in is complete bullshit.
Destiny, soulmates, true love. All that stuff. It's nothing more than silly childhood fairy tale nonsense, isn't it? God!
I should have listened to you, Summer. You were right all along.
What? This is funny? What are you laughing at? (trying himself not to
What are you talking about?!
answer: One day I'm reading a book at the corner deli and this guy sits down and starts asking about it. Now he's my husband!

question: This is funny to you?
answer: What would have happened if I went to the movies instead? If I went somewhere else for lunch? If I showed up to eat ten minutes later? Tom, it was meant to be, just like you said. And as it was happening, I knew it. I could feel it, sure as the sun. And I kept thinking to myself "Holy shit. Tom was right." You were right about all of it. Anyway, I should probably be getting back. It was good to see you. I'm glad you're well.

question: Summer! I really do hope you're happy.
Are you here to interview?
Are you interviewing? For the position?
Yup.
It would appear.
answer: Gee, this is a little awkward.

question: Yes it is.
answer: Well, I hope you don't get it.

question: I hope you don't get it. They both laugh. There's a silence for a few beats. And it's during this time that something weird comes over Tom and we can visibly see it in his face. He likes the look of this girl. This girl is cute. He'd like to talk more with her. And, honestly, he's a little surprised by it.
Hmm?
Grew up not too far from here. Atherton, near Stanford.
Have I seen you before?
answer: I, uh, don't know. I don't think so.

question: Do you go to St. Patrick's? Not to pray or anything but to stand outside?
answer: I do! I love that church. It's like my favorite structure in the city.

question: If only it wasn't near that horrible mirrored thing...

answer: You have? Really? Hmm. I didn't see you.

question: It happens. You probably weren't looking.
